newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Hagemeyer says Q1 up to expectations.
newsitem.headline: Hagemeyer says Q1 up to expectations.

text.p: Dutch trading group Hagemeyer NV said on Thursday first quarter results were in line with expectations and repeated that profits and earnings per share were expected to grow this year.
The average amount of outstanding shares will rise by 9.2 percent compared to a year ago.
"First quarter business was in line with our expectations," Hagemeyer chairman Andrew Land told the group's annual meeting.
"We see continued growth in 1997 earnings per share," he said, although the firm expects a slightly higher tax burden.
"It will not be a big increase, but we expect a small rise in the tax percentage," he said.
Land told Reuters that he saw stronger autonomous growth for the current year compared to 1996 and that he expected a positive contribution from recent acquisitions.
"And, there is also the possibility of further acquisitions," he said.
Hong Kong's First Pacific Co owns an economic stake of approximately 36 percent in Hagemeyer.
